articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: He was 88, and had recently survived a serious bout of double pneumonia.
articles.title: Pope Francis has died, Vatican says in video statement

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: Members of the 1.4 billion-member global Catholic community expressed grief on Monday at the death of Pope Francis, many praising him as a humble man who stood up for the marginalised.
articles.title: Catholics around the world mourn 'humble' Pope Francis

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: President Donald Trump stands behind U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said on Monday, after reports that he shared details of a March attack on Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthis in a message group that included his wife, brother and personal lawyer.
articles.title: Trump stands behind Hegseth after attack plans shared in second Signal chat, White House says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin proposed on Monday bilateral talks with Ukraine for the first time in years, and his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Kyiv was prepared for any discussion to halt attacks on civilian targets.
articles.title: Putin says he is open to direct peace talks with Ukraine

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: The head of Israel's domestic intelligence service said that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's bid to sack him followed his refusal to fulfil requests that included spying on Israeli protesters and disrupting the leader's corruption trial.
articles.title: Israeli spy chief hands court scathing rebuke of Netanyahu bid to sack him

articles.author: Jason Lange
articles.description: President Donald Trump's public approval rating edged down to its lowest level since his return to the White House, as Americans showed signs of wariness over his efforts to broaden his power, a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Monday found.
articles.title: Trump approval rating dips; many wary of his wielding of power, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, ahead in polls in the run-up to an April 28 election, renewed calls on Monday for voters to give him a strong mandate to deal with U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff threat.
articles.title: Carney ahead in polls as Canada enters last week of election campaign

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: President Donald Trump's administration was prepared to carry out deportations of dozens of Venezuelan migrants detained in Texas under a 1798 law historically used only during wartime without judicial review and contrary to the U.S. Supreme Court's prior orders, lawyers told the justices Monday.
articles.title: Venezuelan migrants were set for deportation without judicial review, lawyers tell US Supreme Court

articles.author: Philip Pullella
articles.description: When Pope John Paul II died on the evening of April 2, 2005, the whole world knew it would be coming at any moment.
articles.title: Two papal deaths 20 years apart, one expected, the other a surprise

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Early voting in the Australian election began on Tuesday, with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's centre-left Labor party holding a slim lead over the conservative opposition coalition.
articles.title: Early voting in Australia election begins, PM Albanese's party holds slender lead
